text: Patrick Harold Falkiner Barron, also called Paddy, (13 November 1911 – 27 August 1991) was the fourth Bishop of George.Wits historical papers Barron was educated at Leeds University“Who was Who” 1897-1990 London, A & C Black, 1991 and (after studies at the College of the Resurrection, Mirfield) ordained in 1939.Crockford's Clerical Directory1940-41 Oxford, OUP,1941 He began his ordained ministry a curate at Our Most Holy Redeemer, ClerkenwellChurch website after which he was a chaplain to the South African Army during World War II. After the war he held incumbencies at Zeerust, Potchefstroom and Blyvooruitzicht. Later he was Archdeacon of Germiston, then Dean of Johannesburg. In 1964 he was ordained to the episcopate as Suffragan Bishop of Cape Town and two years later was translated to George."New Bishop Of George", The Times, 17 March 1966.Diocese of George website ==References== Category:1911 births Category:Alumni of the University of Leeds Category:Alumni of the College of the Resurrection Category:Anglican archdeacons in Africa Category:Anglican deans Category:20th-century Anglican bishops Category:Bishops of George Category:1991 deaths Category:South African military chaplains Category:World War II chaplains Category:Deans of Johannesburg
